segment.source: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest (Windows 10)
segment.target: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest (Windows 10)

segment.source: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest
segment.target: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest

segment.source: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest
segment.target: Activate by Proxy an Active Directory Forest

segment.source: You can use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Active Directory-Based Activation (ADBA) function to activate by proxy an Active Directory (AD) forest for an isolated workgroup that does not have Internet access.
segment.target: You can use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Active Directory-Based Activation (ADBA) function to activate by proxy an Active Directory (AD) forest for an isolated workgroup that does not have Internet access.

segment.source: ADBA enables certain volume products to inherit activation from the domain.
segment.target: ADBA enables certain volume products to inherit activation from the domain.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: ADBA is only applicable to Generic Volume License Keys (GVLKs) and KMS Host key (CSVLK).
segment.target: ADBA is only applicable to Generic Volume License Keys (GVLKs) and KMS Host key (CSVLK).

segment.source: To use ADBA, one or more KMS Host keys (CSVLK) must be installed on the AD forest, and client keys (GVLKs) must be installed on the client products.
segment.target: To use ADBA, one or more KMS Host keys (CSVLK) must be installed on the AD forest, and client keys (GVLKs) must be installed on the client products.

segment.source: In a typical proxy-activation scenario, the VAMT host computer distributes a product key to one or more client computers and collects the installation ID (IID) from each computer.
segment.target: In a typical proxy-activation scenario, the VAMT host computer distributes a product key to one or more client computers and collects the installation ID (IID) from each computer.

segment.source: The VAMT host computer sends the IIDs to Microsoft on behalf of the client computers and obtains the corresponding Confirmation IDs (CIDs).
segment.target: The VAMT host computer sends the IIDs to Microsoft on behalf of the client computers and obtains the corresponding Confirmation IDs (CIDs).

segment.source: The VAMT host computer then installs the CIDs on the client computer to complete the activation.
segment.target: The VAMT host computer then installs the CIDs on the client computer to complete the activation.

segment.source: If you use this activation method, only the VAMT host computer needs to have Internet access.
segment.target: If you use this activation method, only the VAMT host computer needs to have Internet access.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For workgroups that are isolated from any larger network, you can still perform an AD forest activation.
segment.target: For workgroups that are isolated from any larger network, you can still perform an AD forest activation.

segment.source: This requires installing a second instance of VAMT on a computer in the isolated group and using removable media to transfer activation data between that computer and another VAMT host computer that has Internet access.
segment.target: This requires installing a second instance of VAMT on a computer in the isolated group and using removable media to transfer activation data between that computer and another VAMT host computer that has Internet access.

segment.source: You can also activate by proxy a KMS Host key (CSVLK) in the core network if you do not want the host computer to connect to Microsoft over the Internet.
segment.target: You can also activate by proxy a KMS Host key (CSVLK) in the core network if you do not want the host computer to connect to Microsoft over the Internet.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Before performing proxy activation, ensure that the network and the VAMT installation meet the following requirements:
segment.target: Before performing proxy activation, ensure that the network and the VAMT installation meet the following requirements:

segment.source: There is an instance of VAMT that is installed on a computer that has Internet access.
segment.target: There is an instance of VAMT that is installed on a computer that has Internet access.

segment.source: If you are performing proxy activation for an isolated workgroup, you must also have VAMT installed on one of the computers in the workgroup.
segment.target: If you are performing proxy activation for an isolated workgroup, you must also have VAMT installed on one of the computers in the workgroup.

segment.source: VAMT has administrative permissions to the Active Directory domain.
segment.target: VAMT has administrative permissions to the Active Directory domain.

segment.source: To perform an Active Directory forest proxy activation
segment.target: To perform an Active Directory forest proxy activation

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: In the left-side pane, click the Active Directory-Based Activation node.
segment.target: In the left-side pane, click the Active Directory-Based Activation node.

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Proxy activate forest to open the Install Product Key dialog box.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Proxy activate forest to open the Install Product Key dialog box.

segment.source: In the Install Product Key dialog box, select the KMS Host key (CSVLK) that you want to activate.
segment.target: In the Install Product Key dialog box, select the KMS Host key (CSVLK) that you want to activate.

segment.source: If you want to rename the ADBA object, enter a new Active Directory-Based Activation Object name.
segment.target: If you want to rename the ADBA object, enter a new Active Directory-Based Activation Object name.

segment.source: If you want to rename the ADBA object, you must do it now.
segment.target: If you want to rename the ADBA object, you must do it now.

segment.source: After you click Install Key, the name cannot be changed.
segment.target: After you click Install Key, the name cannot be changed.

segment.source: Enter the name of the file where you want to save the offline installation ID, or browse to the file location and then click Open.
segment.target: Enter the name of the file where you want to save the offline installation ID, or browse to the file location and then click Open.

segment.source: If you are activating an AD forest in an isolated workgroup, save the .cilx file to a removable media device.
segment.target: If you are activating an AD forest in an isolated workgroup, save the .cilx file to a removable media device.

segment.source: Click Install Key.
segment.target: Click Install Key.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Activating Active Directory dialog box until it completes the requested action.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Activating Active Directory dialog box until it completes the requested action.

segment.source: The activated object and the date that it was created appear in the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the center pane.
segment.target: The activated object and the date that it was created appear in the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the center pane.

segment.source: Insert the removable media into the VAMT host that has Internet access.
segment.target: Insert the removable media into the VAMT host that has Internet access.

segment.source: Make sure that you are on the root node, and that the Volume Activation Management Tool view is displayed in the center pane.
segment.target: Make sure that you are on the root node, and that the Volume Activation Management Tool view is displayed in the center pane.

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Acquire confirmation IDs for CILX to open the Acquire confirmation IDs for file dialog box.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Acquire confirmation IDs for CILX to open the Acquire confirmation IDs for file dialog box.

segment.source: In the Acquire confirmation IDs for file dialog box, browse to where the .cilx file you exported from the isolated workgroup host computer is located.
segment.target: In the Acquire confirmation IDs for file dialog box, browse to where the .cilx file you exported from the isolated workgroup host computer is located.

segment.source: Select the file, and then click Open.
segment.target: Select the file, and then click Open.

segment.source: VAMT displays an Acquiring Confirmation IDs message while it contacts Microsoft and acquires the CIDs.
segment.target: VAMT displays an Acquiring Confirmation IDs message while it contacts Microsoft and acquires the CIDs.

segment.source: When the CID collection process is complete, VAMT displays a Volume Activation Management Tool message that shows how many confirmation IDs were successfully acquired, and the name of the file to which the IDs were saved.
segment.target: When the CID collection process is complete, VAMT displays a Volume Activation Management Tool message that shows how many confirmation IDs were successfully acquired, and the name of the file to which the IDs were saved.

segment.source: Click OK to close the message.
segment.target: Click OK to close the message.

segment.source: Remove the storage device that contains the .cilx file from the Internet-connected VAMT host computer and insert it into the VAMT host computer in the isolated workgroup.
segment.target: Remove the storage device that contains the .cilx file from the Internet-connected VAMT host computer and insert it into the VAMT host computer in the isolated workgroup.

segment.source: Open VAMT and then click the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the left-side pane.
segment.target: Open VAMT and then click the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the left-side pane.

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Apply confirmation ID to Active Directory domain, browse to the .cilx file and then click Open.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Apply confirmation ID to Active Directory domain, browse to the .cilx file and then click Open.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Activating Active Directory dialog box until it completes the requested action.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Activating Active Directory dialog box until it completes the requested action.

segment.source: The activated object and the date that it was created appear in the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the center pane.
segment.target: The activated object and the date that it was created appear in the Active Directory-Based Activation node in the center pane.

segment.target: Related topics
